       Crossing Borders on Fridays

Crossing Borders on Fridays is the winter version of Crossing Borders on the Terrace.   This is a “Village Integration Project” organised by the IEAI on each Friday from 11 November to December 16 between 17.30 and 19.30 and later in some cases.  The Irish meet another culture in the Parliament Corner at The Meeting Point,

Resto-Pub Restaurant, Pizzeria & Bar

39 Rue du Taciturne,  1000 Brussels (Metro Schuman).

Each culture shares information with other nationalities about their culture, holiday and home hunting tips and also on topics such as living and working in Brussels as they laze and chat in the sunshine over a happy hour beer if you come early!

Come along and meet the different nationalities each week.   Guests can come and go at any time and stay longer if they wish. Admission Free……..and please let all your friends who will be in Brussels for the coming weeks.- All nationalities are Welcome!

Full list of Crossing Borders on Fridays  Dates:

description: Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday The Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL in compliance with its aims and objectives will remember for the first time all Irish in all armies who died in all wars and conflicts. IEAI in particular remembers the 50,000 Irish who died during the liberation of Belgium in the first and second world wars. Let those who come after us see to it that their names be not forgotten Hence it will have its first Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday in Brussels on this Saturday 12 November at 12 noon. The IEAI will lay a wreath at the Anglo-Belgian War Memorial at Place Poelaert / Poelaertplein in front of Palais de Justice de Bruxelles and across from the Infantry Memorial of Brussels in memory of the Belgian foot soldiers who fought in World War I and II. (Metro or Tram Louise 3 minutes walk). The Anglo-Belgian War Memorial commemorates the heroic Belgian people who helped the British prisoners of war during World War I. Designed by the British sculptor Charles Sargeant Jagger [masked]), the monument was inaugurated in 1923. The composition, in Brainvilliers stone, features figures of British and Belgian soldiers. The sides are covered with reliefs representing scenes of Belgian common folk tending to wounded British soldiers. There is also a relief of an Irish harp. A plaster cast of the statues of soldiers can be seen at the Military Museum in Brussels. Following the laying of the wreath, a poem by Irish Poet Francis Ledwidge will be recited. He enlisted in the Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers in 1914 and was killed in the battle of Ypres on the 31st July 1917. See www.francisledwidge.com . After the ceremony, guests shall proceed to Mac Sweeney's Irish Pub for warm refreshments at Jean Stasstraat, Brussels 1060 located to the right of Avenue Louise about 7 minutes walk from the memorial. On the way the group shall stop at the site of the former residence in exile of William Smith OBrien, one of the leaders of the Irish Rebellion of 1848. He also lived in Hungary where he advised the Hungarian Independence Movement. It is for this reason that the IEAI will organise the William Smith O´ Brien Irish-Hungarian Annual Memorial Lecture. Every one is welcome to come along to the first Remembrance Saturday ceremony. Cuimhnímid ar na hÉireannaigh go léir a fuair bás sna hairm go léir sna cogaí agus sna coinbleachtaí go léir. Tugaimid Chun cuimhne go háirithe an 50, 000 Éireannach a fuair bás le linn Shaoradh Na Beilge SA chéad agus SA dara cogadh domhanda. 'Go bhféacha an ghlúin a thiocfaidh inár ndiaidh chuige nach ndéanfar dearmad ar a n-ainmneacha siúd'
name: Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday

description: The Saint Patrick's Day Parade of the Nations and Regions takes place on Sunday March 11. We will need 56 Volunteers at least on the day and another 40 volunteers to help with the planning between now and then. The first volunteer meeting takes place on this Saturday 19 November at 12.00 and will last for about 1 and half hours. It will be a review and brainstorming session on how to get the maximum participation from cultural groups in Brussels and from regions around Europe. It will define all the volunteer activities such as events management, poster and web design, social media management , press and public relations and translations of pres releases and of course sponsorship and fund raising etc. Every one is welcome to come along and to let us know what they would like to help in any way.

description: The Irish in Europe Association  launch the Hibernian Social Club at the Aloft Brussels Schuman Hotel, Place Jean Rey, Leopold Village, Brussels 1040 (www.aloftbrussels.com) on Tuesday December 6th. at 18.00h. to 20.30 help Business in Brussels, promote Belgian-Irish and Inter-State Trade in Europe and of course to have a good time over a Guinness or a Cocktail in a Social Club ambiance.  We have changed tactics regarding our room location, we are now in Tactic room III on the first floor as there is a party at the WXYZ Bar on the ground floor and the music may be a bit louder than usual for networking. There will be a Split Happy Hour 18.00 to 18.30 and 20.00 to 20.30. Drinks can be purchased in the WZYZ Bar or ordered at the Social Club. Guests can come and go and stay longer and socialise in the WXYZ Bar if they wish.  Admission is free but please sign the Guest Book and bring your business cards. The Aloft Hotel also kindly invites you to join in the festivities on the ground floor afterwards. All nationalities that have an interest in Ireland and working with the Irish Diaspora in Europe to develop commercial and trade links are most welcome to attend.
name: Launch of the Hibernian Social Club in Brussels

See pre-launch video

www.toastmasters.be

 

Members and Guests are advised to come early before 7pm to secure a good seat as there  will be a lot of Jobee Fans coming around 9pm to hear the concert.

 

Have a Jolly Christmas with many Toasts!!!!!!!

http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/f/2/event_79322802.jpegCladdagh Toastmasters Club of Brussels! Make a New Year's resolution to make new friends and to improve your Communication, Leadership and Social skills! Visit the Claddagh Toastmasters Public Speaking Club which meets at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Metro Schuman) on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 18.45. All persons who can speak English, or Irish and or Scots Gaelic are invited to attend and join what will be a most dynamic, multicultural and friendly club. Guests are not obliged to speak. Admission is free. The formal meeting concludes at 21.00 and then there is the option to go for social drink afterwards. For further details and reservation, contact  Cora de Paor Vice President Public Relations at [masked]

 

Claddagh Toastmasters of Brussels is part of Toastmasters International, a non profit organisation dedicated to the development of communication and leadership skills. There are over 10,000 clubs worldwide and Claddagh is the first registered Irish speaking club in the world! It is also the model bilingual club for the promotion of other bilingual clubs in Brussels using the medium of languages as means of integration rather than a barrier.

 

The Irish in Europe Association International as part of its Village |Integration Project is a Patron of the Toastmaster Bilingual Club Development Programme in Brussels.

Toastmasters bilingual club Mission Statement for Brussels is supported by the Irish in Europe.

“Toastmasters International is a non-profit, non- political, non- religious Educational Voluntary Organisation Promoting Communication, Leadership and Fostering Integration in Brussels through the medium of Bilingual clubs with multicultural memberships”

 

The next bilingual clubs to be formed will be the Gdansk Toastmasters of Brussels -Polish/English and the Dacia Toastmasters of Brussels- Romanian /English.

Through its member clubs, Toastmasters International helps men and women learn the arts of public speaking, listening and thinking – vital skills that promote self-actualisation, enhance leadership potential, foster human understanding, and contribute to the betterment of mankind. A typical meeting will start with a session of impromptu speaking or “table topics” in which members are invited to speak for around two minutes on a subject given without prior notice. There is also a session of prepared speeches meeting the objectives of assignments defined in the various Toastmasters public speaking manuals. Evaluation is an important part of the Toastmaster training process and each speech will be evaluated by a fellow member whose role is to encourage the speaker and recommend ways in which the speech might be improved.

In essence Toastmasters is a self –help group which encourages “learning by doing” in an environment of mutual support. Toastmasters come from all walks of life and the club provides a great opportunity to meet and wide variety of interesting people working towards the common goal of improved communication skills.

Benefits of Toastmaster Membership

 

• More effective communication skills in Irish or English

• Increased leadership skills

•Networking

• Opportunities to participate in Toastmaster activities such as speech contests, leadership training, conferences, etc.

• Communication and Leadership Program Manual (80 Pages)

• Competent Leadership manual 92 pages

• Effective Speech Evaluation booklet 16 pages

• Your speaking Voice booklet 32 pages

• Gestures Your Body speaks booklet 32 pages

• Subscription to The Toastmaster monthly Magazine is included with membership Each meeting gives everyone an opportunity to practice:

• Conducting meetings. • Giving impromptu speeches. Use "table topics" to think on your feet.

• Effectively develop and present ideas :

• Confront and control any nervousness you may have.

 

1. Learn the value of gestures and body movement as part of a speech.

2. Develop a sense of timing and natural, smooth body movement.

3. Focus on areas such as organization, voice, language, and gestures.

4. Utilize vocal variety. Developing the use of volume, pitch, rate and quality.

5. Achieve persuasion by appealing to the audience's self-interest, building a logical foundation for agreement, and arousing the emotional interest of your.

6. Offering & accepting constructive criticism. Every prepared speaker is assigned an evaluator who points out speech strengths and offers suggestions for improvement.

7. Toastmasters produce results. Around the world more than three million men and women of all ages and occupations have benefited from Toastmasters training, and more than one thousand corporations, community groups, universities, associations, and government agencies now use Toastmasters training. www.toastmasters.org

http://sites.google.com/site/claddaghtoastmasters/

description:
Let's leave our beautiful city behind us and head to Bruges. We'll embark IC 1535, leaving Brussels Central Station (Bruxelles Central/Brussel Centraal) at 14:21. Meet outside the door of Starbucks cafe  at 14.00 in the ticket area of the station and allow 10 minutes to buy your ticket. A bit more than one hour later you'll see the Our Lady Church, Saint-Saviours Cathedral and the Belfry tower come in sight. We should arrive  in Bruges at 15:35 although they plan works between Brussel-South and Denderleeuw and Aalter and Landegem during that weekend. So expect a 15 minutes delay between Brussels and Ghent and another (!) 15 minutes between Ghent and Bruges. But no worries ... even if we arrive at 4pm, there is still  lots of beer left to taste and the craic, we make it ourselves!

Once outside the station, a horse tram is waiting (free of charge) to get, via picturesque streets, to the Markt. Where the Belfry Tower has been turned into one big beer bottle. For the 5th time in history the BAB organize their beer festival.

After being admired the beautiful scenery on the half an hour cobblestone dominated tour we arrive at the center piece of the day.

Practically we enter via the gate to the right. The entry itself is free. You can buy a glass for € 3 (not necessary, but pretty vital to enjoy your drink). Besides that, you have to buy tokens (€ 1,25) if you want to consume something. Basicly one token enables you to taste one beer (0,15l). You can buy combos (1 glass + 10 tokens) to get you started.
To have more information about what you're drinking or giving remarks to yourself, you can start giving out those tokens on the catalogue (it is available in English).
Once we got through this hall, we'll pass the Cuisine Culinaire workshop. At this location 4 top chefs of Bruges will prepare some fine dish based on Belgian beer and you can have a bite of it when it finished. All across the festival you'll find TVs, mostly used for promotional purposes but when things are cooking, it's broadcast live on it, so you can keep enjoying your beer.
But we haven't come to the beers yet … therefore we have to go out the building. Go up the steps (the first 15 of the 366 in total)  and you'll arrive in a new world. Brewers heaven! There are 65 brewers present. You simply go with your token and your glass to his booth. He/She will clean it and fill it up with the liquid of your choice. In total you can taste more than 250 different beers. If that doesn't quench your thirst! No need to leave the kids home because they also serve fine water, lemonade and coke. But unfortunately no whiskeys, although you can buy bottles of real Belgian whiskey made with beer (what else?)...

There is food on the premises, such as cheese and sandwiches. And if you don't mind walking out of the festival, there are tons of good bars, restaurants nearby.

When the night has fallen and you long for your bed (caused by fatigue or the high ABV) you can assure you that 2 trains an hour bring you back to the capital of Belgium (and Europe so you will...)

There are regular trains back to Brussels (until 10pm)

20:35 - 21:39 (direction Genk)
20:58 - 22:01 (direction Welkenraedt)
21:35 - 22:39 (direction Genk)
21:58 - 23:01 (direction Welkenraedt)
22:35 - 23:39 (direction Brussel Zuid) !
23:05 - 00:09  (direction Welkenraedt)

If you think you can't make that, there is a hotel just next to the railway station.

(ETAP HOTEL Brugge Centrum Station - from €49/night)

04:50 - 06:01 (direction Eupen)

description:
Lecture is given in English , Admission is free-  Followed by Irish Village Concert at Kitty O Shea's.

 

 

Claddagh TOASTMASTERS Bilingual CLUB OF BRUSSELS

 

MÁISTRÍ SLÁINTÍ an Chladaigh – Club Dátheangach na Bruiséile

 

 Claddagh Toastmasterswill host their fifth annual ‘Seachtain na Gaeilge’ lecture in English Leacht/Lecture (in English) An Ghaeilge: Teanga  Eorpach Nua–Aoiseach / Irish: a modern European Language leis an Dr Seán Ó Riain

on Friday  March 9, 2012 at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1040 Brussels.

Topics include what precisely is European, and what is modern, about the Irish language; some history of how we got to where we are, and a little comparison to languages such as Spanish and Polish. 

The lecture will be preceded by a short demonstration bilingual table topics session. Welcome coffee at 18.45. Given by Dr Seán Ó Riain, a former President of Claddagh Toastmasters, Diplomat and Seconded National Expert at European Commission.  Responsible for the Irish-language version of the Commission website, EUROPA, and for making an ongoing contribution to the evolution of language policy.

 

Come along and find out more on the Irish Language!

 

Admission Free including refreshments. Guests are however to make a small contribution towards the refreshments and room rental. Book early to secure a place.  Registration and details from at [masked].   For other Irish in Europe Féile and Seachtain na Gaeilge events consult www.brussels-st-patricks-day-parade.be.

 

It will be followed by the Irish Village (Irish in Europe Association) Night of  at Kitty O’ Sheas – Free admission.

The Irish Roots Tour–Hattie St. John (2nd.Finalist new Zealand Music Awards )Originals, Folk Blues, Pop Oldies.  http://www.hattiestjohn.de/index.php

 

 Dr Seán Ó Riain - 32 years of diplomatic service in Brussels (EU), Germany, Austria, Poland, Australia. PhD (TCD) on language policy, “Language Planning in Ireland and Québec”. Some legal studies.  He has worked for 4.5 years at the European Commission, 16 years at 5 Irish embassies, 11 years in Iveagh House; and 2 years lecturing in Irish at Maynooth University.

 

Claddagh TOASTMASTERS Bilingual CLUB OF BRUSSELS

MÁISTRÍ SLÁINTÍ an Chladaigh –Club Dátheangach na Bruiséile

Cabhraíonn Club Máistrí Sláintí an Chladaigh chun do scileanna sa chaint phoiblí, sa phleanáil, san oiliúint agus sa bhainistíocht a fhorbairt.  Sa Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 An Bhruiséil (Métro Schuman) a thagann an club le chéile. Caife/fáilte  ar 18.45. Is féidir dátaí cruinnithe a athrú i ngeall ar shaoire agus cúinsí eile.

 

Claddagh Toastmasters helps you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, training, and managing your time. We aim is to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice your skills.  We are a bilingual Irish-English club, which requires that most members have a good oral command of both Irish and or English. However, in practice, this is not really possible, so we are very pleased to welcome English-only speakers.  To date, the use of Irish and English is fairly balanced during an evening. For example, the Toastmaster of the evening performs performing his/her role in both Irish and English, and we try to alternate speeches and table topics being between both languages, whenever possible.  Guests are welcome, and will be asked for a short introduction at the start of the meeting and for their feedback at the end of the meeting.

 Come and experience it for yourself!

 

We meet at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Metro Schuman), on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm. 


Next Claddagh Meeting Thursday March 15,  [masked], to confirm your place. Admission is free.

description:
The Saint Patrick's Day Parade in Brussels needs your Support.

De Brusselse Saint Patrick’s Day Parade heeft uw steun nodig.

Le Parade du jour de Saint Patrick a besoin de votre soutien

Dear Friends, In April last year, after three years of dedicated, hard work, the Irish in Europe Association (International) aisbl received official recognition by the Belgian State, acknowledged by Royal Decree. Each year, our Saint Patrick’s Day Parade Committee organises a Parade to mark our National Day of Celebration. To date, we have successfully organised three Parades. This year, we plan to continue this tradition with a fourth one.

Can you help us achieve this? With very little effort, you could! A small donation is all that it takes. Our organisation is run entirely on a voluntary basis and currently receives no external financial support or funding. Most of the Parade costs in previous years were paid for by contributions from members and volunteers, and by small donations received. But we can’t expect the same people to pay the costs every year.

We need “a little help from our friends”. That’s where you can play your part to make it work. We cannot engage any marching band or cultural group and organise Parade-related activities unless we have sufficient funds in our bank account or reliable pledges of financial support by the next few weeks. Even if you can only make a small contribution, it’s enough to make a difference. It will ensure that the Parade can be successful, enjoyable and good fun.

The Parade is at 13h30 on Sunday, 11th of March. It starts at the statue of ‘Le Chien Vert’ in the corner of Park Cinquantenaire. Participation is free and it makes a lovely afternoon family outing.

Donations can be made in two ways: (i) by Bank transfer to:: IEAI Bank Account No:[masked] IBAN: BE[masked] SWIFT/BIC-code: SPAABE22

(ii) by Credit card via Pay Pal. Donations made through this site are processed using a secure server. Access it by this link: http://www.brussels-st-patricks-day-parade.be/Home/xml-page/donation-form.

If you’d like to know more about the Parade, have a look at further info about it on our Website. www.brussels-st-patricks-day-parade.be .

Thank you for reading this and thanks in advance for whatever contribution you decide to make.

Denis J. Buckley

President

Saint Patrick’s Day Parade of the Nations and Regions Committee

Tel:[masked] 707.

[masked]

De Brusselse Saint Patrick’s Day Parade heeft uw steun nodig Beste vrienden, In april vorig jaar, na drie jaar hard werk, werd de Irish in Europe Association (International) ivzw officieel erkend door de Belgische Staat bij koninklijk besluit. Ons Saint Patrick's Day Parade Comité organiseert elk jaar een parade ter gelegenheid van onze nationale feestdag. Tot op heden hebben we met succes drie optochten georganiseerd. Dit jaar zijn we van plan om deze traditie verder te zetten met een vierde optocht. We hebben dan ook uw steun nodig om dit te realiseren. Een kleine donatie zal alvast veel helpen. Onze organisatie wordt immers op volledig vrijwillige basis gedragen en ontvangt momenteel dan ook geen externe financiële steun of financiering. De jongste jaren werden de meeste kosten van de optocht betaald door bijdragen van leden en vrijwilligers en via kleine donaties. Maar we kunnen niet verwachten dat dezelfde mensen jaar in jaar uit deze kosten dragen. We hebben "een beetje hulp van onze vrienden" nodig. U kan hierin een rol spelen. We kunnen geen muziekensemble of culturele groep uitnodigen en andere met de optocht gerelateerde activiteiten organiseren, zonder voldoende geld op de bank of zonder betrouwbare beloften van financiële steun in de komende weken. Zelfs een kleine bijdrage is genoeg om een verschil te maken. De optocht kan zo een succesvol, plezierig en leuk evenement worden. De Parade gaat door op zondag 11 maart om 13.30u. en begint bij het standbeeld 'Le Chien Vert' op de hoek van het Jubelpark. Deelname is gratis en het is een perfecte uitstap voor de hele familie. Donaties kunnen op twee manieren : (i) Via overschrijving: IEAI bankrekeningnummer:[masked] IBAN: BE[masked] SWIFT/BIC-code: SPAABE22 (ii) Door creditcard via Pay Pal. Donaties via deze site worden verwerkt met behulp van een beveiligde server. Le Parade du jour de Saint Patrick a besoin de votre soutien Madame, Monsieur, Le Comité du Défilé du jour Saint Patrick fait partie de l’association « Irish in Europe International ». Après trois années de travail dévoué, cette association a été reconnue par l’Etat Belge et confirmée par ordonnance Royale, en avril 2011. Ce Comité a réussi à organiser un défilé chaque année pour célébrer notre jour National Irlandais. Nous voudrions continuer cette tradition cette année avec notre 4ème défilé. Pourriez-vous nous aider avec ce projet ? Avec peu d’effort, vous pourriez ! Une petite donation est tout ce qu’il faudrait. Notre Comité de Parade St. Patrick fonctionne uniquement grâce au travail des volontaires – principalement irlandais. Il ne reçoit aucun soutien financier externe ou subvention. Les frais des défilés ces trois dernières années ont été couverts par les contributions des membres et les donations des volontaires. Nous ne pourrions pas demander aux mêmes personnes de payer les frais chaque année. Cette année, nous avons besoin d’un petit peu d’aide de nos amis et de ceux qui aiment participer à notre Défilé irlandais. Nous ne pourrions pas engager les Bandes de Musique Traditionnelle Irlandaise, ou les groupes de Danse Irlandaise traditionnelle, qui font partie intégrale du Défilé, si nous n’avons pas les fonds nécessaires pour couvrir les frais. Nous devons confirmer ces engagements pour début mars. Votre contribution, même si elle est petite, ferait une grande différence. Elle aiderait à assurer un Défilé réussi, beau à voir et agréable pour ceux qui participent et qui viennent le regarder. Notre Parade de Saint Patrick aura lieu à 13h30 dimanche le 11 mars. Cela commencera près de la statue du « Chien Vert », situé au coin du Parc Cinquantenaire. Participation est gratuite et c’est un évènement familial et agréable. Voici les coordonnées pour les deux façons par lesquelles on peut faire une donation: (i) Virement bancaire à : Compte No. [masked] - de notre association IEAI IBAN : BE[masked] BIC/SWIFT code : SPAABE22 (ii) Carte Bancaire via Pay Pal. Les donations effectuées par cette méthode sont sécurisés. Accès par ce lien : http://www.brussels-st-patricks-day-parade.be/Home/xml-page/donation-form Pour plus d’ info s sur le Parade St. Patrick, veuillez voir : www.brussels-st-patricks-day-parade.be Avec mes remerciements sincères d’avance pour la contribution que vous souhaiteriez faire. Denis J. Buckley

description:
Guest Motivational International Speaker

at the Hibernian Social Club of Brussels

 

The Irish in Europe Association invite you to the next meeting of

 

the Hibernian Social Club of Brussels

 

on Monday 12 March  from 18h15 to 20h00

 

Venue: ACI EUROPE, 6 Square de Meeûs, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

 

The Hibernian Social Club is pleased to announce that we have a special guest Speaker from Ireland, Mr. Ted Corcoran DTM, former President of Toastmasters International-the worldwide organisation, a former UK/IRL Public Speaking Champion. Dublin based Leadership and Management Consultant, Author of the Leadership Bus (http://theleadershipbus.com/index.html), Parade Grand Marshal of the Brussels Saint Patrick’s Day Parade 2012. Ted will give a leadership presentation entitled “I wish my Boss would…”

 

Seats are limited and you need to reserve your place to [masked]

Welcome coffee and teas from 18h15.  Admission is free but please signs the Guest Book and bring your business cards. At around 8pm guests are welcome to go the bar in the adjoining Stanhope Hotel through rear entrance on Square de Meeûs 4. Guests can come and go and stay longer and socialise in the Bar if they wish.

 

All nationalities that have an interest in Ireland and working with the Irish Diaspora in Europe to develop commercial and trade links are most welcome to attend.

 

The Hibernian Social Club was established to help Business in Brussels, promote Belgian-Irish and Inter-State Trade in Europe and of course to have a good time over a drink in a Social Club ambiance.

 

The Irish in Europe Association celebrates the launch of the of the new Brussels-Cork Aer Lingus direct flights from March 26 and will outline its awareness building campaign on Monday  how it will assist in the promotion of the route to ensure its success to make it viable to have an all year round service.

 

We look forward to meeting you on Monday and to a great motivational presentation on Leadership from our distinguished international speaker.

 

Best wishes,

Denis J. Buckley

International President

description:
Eamonn Bates at Waterstone's! The topic is Lobbying in the EU and Eamonn will be open to questions. 4pm. FREE.

 

 


eamonn bates europe is a public affairs consultancy specialising in the political process of the European Union (EU) and providing services to corporations, industry associations and public authorities.

Good public affairs practice is grounded in high quality information. eamonn bates europe has an extensive network of contacts in and around the EU institutions in Brussels and beyond. This network and an excellent professional reputation facilitate our issue research and information collection for clients. The same attributes also help when a client's goal is communication — getting the right message to the right people at the right time in the most appropriate manner. eamonn bates europe has particularly extensive experience in what we call the "protection policy" areas of the EU (such as environment, occupational health and safety, public health, and consumer protection). Many years of EU public affairs practice enable us, however, to be effective in a range of other policy fields as well.

Our high-end, bespoke strategy and advocacy services, conceived and executed for each client at Director level, are perhaps the best available today.
name: Public Lecture on  Lobbying in the EU

description:
The Brussels-Cork Airport Support Group welcomes the first Aer Lingus Innaugural Direct Non-Stop  Flight from Cork on March 26.

Cork Irish Village 2012 -Brussels-

Aer Lingus Twinning Brussels and Cork.

The Saint Patrick’s Day Parade Committee each year designates in the Schuman Area of the EU Quarter in Brussels an Area to be known as the Irish Village to be named after a town in Ireland with cultural, trade or heritage significance and on a rotational basis. The Parade route takes place each year in this designated Irish village.

The Parade Committee had shortlisted a number of towns in Ireland for the twinning project to promote that town in the Irish Village Area and of course in Belgium at large. On been informed on December 23rd last that Aer Lingus were to commence direct flights between Brussels and Cork from March 26, the Committee reviewed its decision and decided in the Irish National interest and in the interest of greater Irish – Belgian Trade and Cultural Relations to designate the Village this year as the Cork Irish Village and to make an all out effort to help make this new route viable to become an all year round service.

 

The Irish in Europe Association launched a public relations awareness campaign in January in Belgium and Ireland calling on people to support this new route. (See http://www.meetup.com/Irish-in-Europe/files/ ) Aer Lingus will fly three times a week between Cork and the Capital of the European Union from March 26 to October 26. Flights will depart Cork on Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 11h00, arriving 13h35, with the return leg leaving Brussels at 14h15, and landing back in Ireland at 14h 55.

www.aerlingus.com

Special Promotions of Cork and the South West region will continue during 2012 in addition to the other promotions to promote the island of Ireland as a holiday destination.

You can help promote the viability of the Brussels – Cork route by following the Brussels -Cork Airport Support Group on face book.

The Irish in Europe Association will continue its campaign to have direct Flights between Brussels and Shannon International Airport in the West of Ireland.
name: Brussels Airport Welcome Party for 1st. Cork Aer Lingus Flight

The Game of Rugby - How it is played......

see video link -

http://uk.video.search.yahoo.com/play?p=how%20is%20rugby%20played&tnr=21&vid=4892565316173907&l=178&turl=http%3A%2F%2Fts4.mm.bing.net%2Fvideos%2Fthumbnail.aspx%3Fq%3D4892565316173907%26id%3D8823100b7f87733bd658e969448c0eff%26bid%3DHd5YG5jOh2ZREg%26bn%3DThumb%26url%3Dhttp%253a%252f%252fwww.5min.com%252fVideo%252fLearn-About-Rugby-517157533&rurl=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.5min.com%2FVideo%2FLearn-About-Rugby-517157533&sigr=11lou1r27&newfp=1&tit=Learn+About+Rugby

Rugby union is a game for two teams of 15 players to play. There are many rules to the game so i suggest you look them up if your interested. the main ones are:
Hold the balls in your hands,
Pass it backwards
During the game you may kick the ball, there are rules conserning this and i can't be bothered to explain.
Tackling, to perform an effective tackle you must wrap your arms around the opposition's legs, just above knee height, and hold on until they fall over. tackling above the hips has it's uses but is more difficult and less effective. You can tackle anyone above shoulder height.
The team
the team consists of 8 forwards and 7 backs.
the forwards are aranged with the two biggest on either side of another reasonably big person. these are called props (either side) and a hooker in the middle (its not what you think)
Then there are two taller than average and well built people behind them these are called the second row.
Then the back row consists of two flankers and one number 8.
the backs are 1 scrum half, 1 fly half, 1 inside centre, 1 outside centre, 2 wings, and 1 full back.
The game it's self is mainly people from either side trying to score trys (5 points) drop goals and penelties (3 points) and conversions (taken after a try is scored 2 points).
This is done by the team with the ball running at the the team without the ball with a number of rucks (where each team compets for the ball on the floor) and mauls (each team trys to get the ball of the other when its off the ground).

description:
Jan Kelley from London with strong Irish-American connections will launch her Tourist Guide to Paris during the French Revolution which includes some interesting Irish links.

 

 

BOOK LAUNCH
Path of the Patriots
A Tourist Guide to Paris During the French Revolution

DATE
Thursday 31 May from 18:00
18:00: Cocktail
20:00: Presentation of the book by the author

VENUE
The event will take place at:
295 Avenue dAuderghem
B-1040 Brussels

DESCRIPTION
Take a historical time trip through the streets where it all happened, to where Parisians lived, worked, ate and drank, rose up in arms, and to where many ended their lives under the blade of the guillotine.

The two books contain ten walks which take the reader around different neighborhoods that were instrumental in the Revolution. Each walk gives the visitor a complete experience of the atmosphere of that area during this period by pointing out the people and revolutionary events associated with it. Also included are references to contemporary architecture, and some of the more colourful residents, as well as restaurants, brasseries and cafés with a revolutionary history. Each walk is full of stories and
anecdotes, as well as illustrations, maps and detailed instructions.
They reveal hidden treasures that will never be found in a typical tourist guide of Paris.

Path of the Patriots is a two volume goldmine of tales and anecdotes
about this turbulent period in Paris's history, and it tells you where to eat and drink while reading them.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:
Jan Kelley is from London, but has spent much of her adult life in other places, including New York, Boston and Paris. Her professional life has been equally varied, ranging from teacher to translator and writer.
A life-long love of history coupled with living in the ancient heart of Paris led her to write this book.

It took all the daring of an English author to write a guide that
transports the walker back in time to the Paris of the French Revolution. From the dwindling splendour of a Versailles cut off from the realities of late 18th-century France, Jan Kelley leads us with passion and enthusiasm, animated by numerous contemporary eye-witness accounts, on a comprehensive and detailed journey through a Paris full of darkness and of hope. Her book illuminates this difficult and complex period -one that opened the door to a shining age of liberty.

- Frédéric Lacaille,
Curator, Musée National des Chateaux de Versailles et Trianon

RSVP
To register, please send an email with "Path of the Patriots" in the subject field and stating clearly your NAME to: janni_kelley@ yahoo.com or
phone[masked]

CONTACT
janni_kelley@ yahoo.com

description:
At Kitty O' Sheas Irish Pub - Metro Schuman

The Votes of the Irish Electorate will be counted on June 1.Will the Irish give  approval to the Fiscal Treaty? A yes Vote is Expected but if there is a low turnout  due to the bad weather,it could be a cliff hanger!. A Good time to discuss the implications for a positive or negative vote. Watch live as the votes are counted and as the regional results are announced.

Up date Comment June 1

The bad weather has drowned out support for both sides. Did it turn out to be the class referendum? It will be a cliff hanger result and the general view is that the Yes may have the edge with the closest of margins. Some of the Irish in Europe will be looking on at the Referendum Count Party at Kitty O’ Shea’s Irish Pub in Brussels from 5pm. On the agenda regardless of the referendum outcome will be a round table Irish in Europe discussion on how growth, job creation and investment can be best achieved and what is feasible to be agreed at the European Council Meeting later in the month. An idea under discussion is that there should be an European Convention in July on the rejuvenation of the EU Economy engaging all the Stakeholders from Government, Commerce and Civic Society interests in Europe.

Organised by Irish Democrats Abroad Europe- the Political Affairs Committee of the Irish in Europe Association. Please note members of the Irish Diaspora other than Irish Diplomats do not have a vote in Irish elections or in this referendum. Every one welcome who has an interest in the future of Europe! Admission Free.

Toastmasters are a non profit leadership and communication international organisation that are in Belgium over 40 years. www.toastmasters.org.

In 2006 the Toastmasters bilingual club development program was launched in Brussels.
A Romanian–English bilingual club will be launched this year. The new club will be called Dacia Toastmasters of Brussels. When established, it will meet on the 2nd and 4th, Wednesday of the month. Dacia Toastmasters will help you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, training, and managing your time. The club will aim to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice your leadership and communication skills. Anyone who has knowledge of Romanian and or English is most welcome to join.

The first demonstration meeting is due to take place on Wednesday 27 June at 19.00
at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Metro Schuman) Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm. Admission free – All are welcome.

www.toastmasters.org

In 2006 a fost lansat in Bruxelles programul de creare a cluburilor Toastmasters bilingve.

Un club bilingv român – englez va fi lansat anul acesta. Noul club se va numi Dacia Toastmasters of Brussels. Dupa inființarea clubului, vor fi reuniuni in fiecare a doua şi a patra miercure a lunii.
Dacia Toastmasters vă va ajuta in dezvoltarea abilității de a vorbi in public, bazată pe dezvoltarea personală, în principal pe comunicare, oratorie, inițiative, organizarea timpului şi leadership. Scopul clubului este de a crea un mediu social agreabil in care fiecare să-şi poată practica şi dezvolta leadership-ul şi abilitățile de comunicare in public.
Toate persoanele care vorbesc limba română şi/sau engleză sunt invitate să participe.

Bloomsday on the 16th of June is celebrated as a holiday by scholars and fans of Ulysses, the novel by James Joyce. It was on this day that the events of the novel took place in Dublin in 1904.

Bloomsday is named after Leopold Bloom - a Hungarian, the middle-aged advertising salesman who is the protagonist of the famous book by Joyce, which was published in 1922.Come along in the fashion of 1904 or in your own country traditional costume if you wish.

There will be readings from Ulysses with a special recital by Dénes Dosztán (Violinist, Pianist and Teacher www.denesdosztan.com) of Irish and Hungarian music that was played in Hungary and Ireland in 1904. Look out for the Celtic Nations Mid-Summer BBQ on June 21 and the “Crossing Borders on the Terrace” integration network events during the summer.

Organised by the Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL

(Incorporating the Brussels Saint Patrick’s Day Parade Committee)

Irish and Hungarian Tourist and Cultural Information at Event

All are welcome! Admission free

On 23 June 2012 (09h00-18h00),Belgium GAA will host the third round of the Benelux Regional Football and Ladies Football Championship 2012, with teams visiting from the Netherlands, Luxembourg and Germany.

This tournament will take place in the excellently located surroundings of the Kituro Rugby Club (www.kituro.be).
Kituro Schaerbeek Rugby Club

Avenue des Jardins 50b, 1030 Schaerbeek


Bus 63 from Gare Centrale () stops at Leopold III, which is very close to the pitches.

Click the following (very very long link) to see a map from bus-stop to pitches: https://maps.google.com/maps?saddr=Leopold+III+bus+stop&daddr=Kituro+Rugby+Club%2C+Avenue+des+Jardins%2C+Schaerbeek%2FSchaarbeek%2C+Belgien&hl=en&ll=50.859277%2C4.398683&spn=0.003542%2C0.....

It's going to be a great day, so spread the word to your friends, families, work colleagues and any other close or distant acquaintances who need to spend a few hours on the side of a pitch, appreciating the glory of Gaelic football in Europe.

Performed by Dan and Michael Condron and produced by Philip Crawford for Happenstance Theatre Company, the show is a fantastic slice of Belfast life based on Dan's personal experience of growing up around the famous East Belfast shipyard where the Titanic was built, it celebrates the city’s great shipbuilding heritage in a clever, funny and poignant tale of friendship, skill, pride and heart.

description:
We celebrate the life of Francis Ledwidge

Francis Edward Ledwidge was an Irish war poet from County Meath. Sometimes known as the "poet of the blackbirds", The Poetry of Ledwidge is an integral part of the Treasury of Irish Verse.

On 31 July 1917, a group from Ledwidge's battalion of the Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers were road-laying in preparation for an assault during the Third Battle of Ypres, near the village of Boezinge, northwest of Ieper (Ypres). While Ledwidge was drinking tea in a mud hole with his comrades, a shell exploded alongside, killing the poet and five others. A chaplain who knew him, Father Devas, arrived soon after, and recorded "Ledwidge killed, blown to bits."

The poems Ledwidge wrote on active service revealed his pride at being a soldier, as he believed, in the service of Ireland. He wondered whether he would find a soldier's death. The dead were buried at Carrefour de Rose, and later re-interred in the nearby Artillery Wood Military Cemetery, Boezinge, (where the Welsh poet Hedd Wyn, killed on the same day, is also buried). A stone tablet commemorates him in the Island of Ireland Peace Park, Messines, Belgium. His work as “peasant poet” and “soldier poet”, once a standard part of the Irish school curriculum, faded from view for many decades of the 20th century. Its intensity, coupled with a revived interest in his period, has restored it to life.

The reading of his poem "Ireland" forms part of the wreath laying ceremony for annual Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday Commemoration. For the first ceremony in 2011, the poem was recited by Mary Jo Mullarkey.

Every one is welcome along to this poetry table to learn more about the poet.Admission Free.

Please visit www.francisledwidge.com and be sure to visit while in Ireland the Francis Ledwidge Museum at Janesville,Slane,County Meath.
name: Francis Ledwidge Poetry Table on the Terrace

description:
All Irish in Europe Members and Friends are invited to the Fifth Annual European Theme Special Claddagh Toastmasters Meeting

To celebrate and create awareness for the 2012 European Year for Active Ageing and Solidarity between Generations

Thursday August 2th.  Welcome coffee at 18.45, Meeting 19.00 to 21.00

Admission Free.


The objective this year is to inform ourselves of the need to bring new solutions to the pending challenges of an ageing society in Europe, to promote active citizenship and stimulate awareness on how people can continue to contribute to the economy and society in Brussels and to look after themselves as they grow old. We would like to focus on all issues including active and healthy ageing and different perceptions of ageing and in particular the obstacles that prevent solidarity between the generations in Brussels.


Everyone welcome-admission free. Please let your friends know about this meeting!

The format for this meeting will be different from Normal Club meetings.

1. Marathon Table Topic Session - Speakers will be allowed to speak up to 3 minutes if they so wish. There will no be no evaluation of table topics. The objective is to encourage members and guests to contribute to the meeting and stimulate discussion.

2. After the Coffee Break will have some prepared speeches on the theme subject and based on speech objectives. Speeches will not receive oral evaluation but instead written ones.

3. Following the prepared speeches, there will be an open forum discussion with panel discussion with audience participation with the Toastmaster of the evening serving as Moderator. Persons who deliver prepared speeches and some persons who speak on table topics will be invited to serve on the panel.

4. The meeting will adjourn to the Meeting Point afterwards for a social and network drink and the Claddagh Club will go into summer recess until September 6th. However in will participate in the Bilingual Area Toastmasters Recruitment and Back to Work BBQ on Friday 31st August hosted by Dacia Toastmasters.

The Active Ageing meeting is open to other Toastmaster Club members and members of the general public.

We have already have confirmation that Elena Solliwn Gelpke DTM will give a key note speech titled ‘Opportunities’ at our Thursday TM meeting.

We also invite Toastmaster members and guests to submit subjects in advance to [masked] that you would like to be covered in the table topics session and or in the open forum discussion.

The ultimate objective of the meeting is to emphasise how planning can play an important role in active ageing and how Toastmasters is an ideal organisation to serve all generations to help you plan and enjoy an active life.

Yours in Toastmastering,

Denis J. Buckley

Toastmaster of the Evening

PS A Special word of congratulations to PhilipYaffee,ACB,CL Member of Claddagh Toastmasters of Brussels who has a letter to the editor published in the July edition of the Toastmaster magazine on page 4 titled Super-sensitive subjects. This is not the first time that Phil has had articles and letters published in this publication and it is a great honour for the Club to be recognised as the magazine is read by the world wide membership of 270,000 strong attending one of the 13,000 clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.


Claddagh Toastmasters
http://sites.google.com/site/claddaghtoastmasters/
1st and 3rd Thursday of the month, welcome coffee at 6.45 pm.
Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels
The Claddagh Toastmasters club can help you to develop your public speaking and communication skills in English or Gaeilge in a fun and social environment with an international group. You can attend a club meeting as a guest to see what it's like.
name: Invitation to 2012 European Year for Active Ageing Meeting

Everyone welcome-admission free!!!


Women's Lightweight (51-60 kg)

Katie Taylor - Women Boxing


Katie Taylor, Irish World Champion Women Boxing
Irish boxer Katie Taylor, Ireland's world champion women boxing , is an amazing athlete and unstoppable as the world’s top female boxer in the last three consecutive years. Female boxer Katie Taylor is actively pursuing her dream of making women's boxing an official Olympic sport for the first time in the history of the Olympic Games.

Katie Taylor, Boxing Ireland


Her energy and personality make her a charismatic inspiration for girls, women and people everywhere in Ireland and abroad and as World Champion Boxing 2008 and 2007, Triple European Champion Boxing and Captain of the Irish Female Football Team, she represents her country Ireland at the highest levels in both boxing and football.

Lightweight double World Champion boxing, Katie Taylor from Bray, Co. Wicklow, Ireland, started boxing in 1998. She comes from a family with a boxing background - her coach at the St. Fergal's Boxing Club in Bray is her father Peter who was 1986 Irish senior light heavyweight champion boxer and her mother is a boxing referee.

Katie Taylor first made Irish boxing history - at age 15 - on October[masked] in the first officially sanctioned women's bout ever held in Ireland. She fought 16-year-old Alanna Audley (now Alanna Murphy) of Belfast at the National Stadium in Dublin in the first of three female contests on a sixteen-bout amateur card. Katie Taylor won over three 90-second rounds by 23-12.

Katie Taylor made Irish boxing history again at age 18 in May 2005 when she became the first Irish woman to win a Gold Medal at the Senior European Boxing Championships.

description:
Ireland's John Joe Nevin upset Cuban world bantamweight champion Lazaro Alvarez Estrada to move a step away from emulating team mate Katie Taylor's rare Irish gold after 10 men's Olympic finalists were decided on Friday 10 August.

Come and join in the party and watch John Joe Nevin punch his way for a Gold Medal at the London Olympics.Everyone welcome-admission free!!!

 

John Joe Nevin is through to the Olympic bantamweight final after beating Cuba's reigning world champion Lazaro Alvarez Estrada 19-14.
Nevin won all three rounds at the ExCeL Arena, taking the first 5-3, the second 7-6 and the final round 7-5.
The Mullingar boxer will fight Britain's Luke Campbell in the final on Saturday 11 August  at 9.45pm. Come  early to get the best seats......
John Joseph Nevin (born 7 June 1989), more commonly known as John Joe Nevin, is an Irish amateur boxer. He won the Irish national boxing title and qualified for the 2008 Summer Olympics at the age of 18. Four years later he qualified for the 2012 Summer Olympics, winning a medal.
Nevin was born in in Mullingar, County Westmeath.
Career
Nevin lost 11:14 to Aaron Casey at the 2006 World Junior Championships at 48 kg. 2012 Olympics Nevin qualified for the 2008 Beijing Olympics by winning the 1st European Qualifying Tournament. Nevin subsequently won the 2008 European Union boxing championships.
In the 2008 Beijing Olympics he beat Abdelhalim Ourradi 9-4 in his first round before being beaten by Enkhbatyn Badar-Uugan 9-2 in the round of 16. On 9 September 2009, Nevin guaranteed Ireland a historic sixth medal at the 2009 World Amateur Boxing Championships after he beat China's Yu Gu in Milan. He won his quarter-final 7-5.[1] In the semi-final he lost by 5-4 to Russian Eduard Abzalimov, and so took away a bronze medal.[2] In Baku, Azerbaijan he qualified for the 2012 London Olympic games by reaching the quarter-finals of the 2011 AIBA World Boxing Championships, subsequently he reached the semi-finals by beating Orzubek Shaymov of Uzbekistan 19-17 to claim another world championship bronze medal, as a result he has the distinction of being the first Irish boxer in history to claim two world championship medals.
In 2012 he beat his cousin Michael Nevin in the final of the Senior National All Irelands 23–3 to win his fifth national senior title in a row. He boxes out of Cavan boxing club under coach Brian McKeown. He signed with the Paris United Team in October 2010 in "The World Series of Boxing (WSB") and helped them win the Championship.
Nevin won his first fight in the 2012 Olympic Games, defeating Denmark's Dennis Ceylan by a wide margin of 21-6.[3]. In his second fight of the games he saw off Kazakhstan’s Kanat Abutalipov by a margin of 15-10. [4]. In his quarter-final bout he beat Oscar Valdez to secure a semi-final place and a guarantee of a bronze medal.[5] He then reached the final after defeating the reigning bantamweight world champion Lázaro Álvarez of Cuba 19-14.[6]

The Flemish Broadcasting Company (www.vrt.be) is currently preparing a new online platform and television program especially for expats living in Flanders. See also http://www.flanderstoday.eu/content/especially-fans

Within the program there is an item that is called Home & Away. For this item they are looking for nationalities living and working in Flanders. They wonder what they are do besides work in their past time and to what extent they are in touch with the aspects of every day life of their motherland. Within this item they try to find out what it means to be for a certain nationality (Irish, Italian, Congolese, American, etc) living in Flanders.

On Friday March 24th, they are seeking 4 Irish people to meet up for a round table discussion and a test TV shooting from 12.30 to about 6pm, at a location near Place Jourdan. They are particularly interested in irish people who are interested in spirituality/Law of Attraction/Yoga/alternative therapies. If interested and available, contact me at [masked]

description:
CLADDAGH ENGLISH/IRISH TOASTMASTERS CLUB OF BRUSSELS TOASTMASTER AN CHLADAIGH – CLUB DÁTHEANGACH NA BRUISÉILE

 

Claddagh Toastmasters helps you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, leadership training, and managing your time. We aim is to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice your skills.

We are a bilingual Irish-English club with a membership from about ten different nationalities, which requires that most members have a good oral command of  Irish and or  English. However, in practice, this is not really possible  unless we have a high number of  Irish speakers at all meetings , so we are very pleased to welcome English-only speakers.  To date, the use of Irish and English is fairly balanced for some sessions during an evening . For example, the Toastmaster of the evening performs performing his/her role in both Irish and English, and we try to alternate speeches and table topics being between both languages, whenever possible but for the coming months we may have English only sessions until the membership of our Irish speakers increases.

Guests are welcome, and will be asked for a short introduction at the start of the meeting and for their feedback at the end of the meeting. Come and experience it for yourself!

The ultimate objective of the meeting is to emphasise how planning can play an important role in active aging and how Toastmasters is an ideal organisation to serve all generations to help you plan and enjoy an active life.

Click Next Meetings to find a date that suits you, and email[masked], to confirm your place. Admission is free. We meet at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Métro Schuman), on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm.

description:
http://photos2.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/2/d/c/0/event_156191712.jpegSunday September 9  From 3pm

2012 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship Final

All Ireland Final. Galway V Kilkenny  kick off at 4.30 pm  preceded by Minor Match

Irish in Europe Association meet up at Old Oak Irish Pub and Restaurant at 26 Rue Franklin ,Brussels 1000,Belgium. All are welcome to watch this fascinating game and the clash of the ash. Come earlier and enjoy the Sunday Lunch!

 

There can be only one winner video


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=owMsDhWo-PY

 

The Game of Hurling for men of courage.

The oldest field game in Europe, the fastest field game in the world - just two of the things we are able to boast about this ancient celtic game.A traditional Irish field sport in which a ball, called a sliotar, is caught on a hurley, or stick, and carried, or hurled into the opponent's goal. Irish mythology has tales of the warrior Cu Chulainn and other legendary heroes who were expert hurlers. The rules of play were standardized in 1884 when the Gaelic Athletic Association was founded. Today the game is almost entirely restricted to Ireland, where the All-Ireland championship competition has been held since 1887.

 

How the game is played...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurling

The city of Fosses-La-ville, not far from Namur, owes its origin to Foillan an Irish monk wo came to evangelize the country around 650 AD.

After is tragic death he became Saint Feuillen the Patron Saint of the city.
Since that time the city kept a strong connection with Ireland. They have an Irish high Cross at the church place and also a replica of the Gallarus Oratory
from Dingle - Co. Kerry.
You can visit there website: www.saintfeuillen2012.be (They have a version in English)


Ps. They have also a very nice local beer: The "St. Feuillen"
name: IEAI Visit to ST. Feuillen Festival in Fosses-La-Ville

2012 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship Final

All Ireland Final. Galway V Kilkenny kick off at 4.30 pm preceded by Minor Match Replay with Dublin V Tipperary

Irish in Europe Association meet up at Old Oak Irish Pub and Restaurant at 26 Rue Franklin ,Brussels 1000,Belgium. All are welcome to watch this fascinating game and the clash of the ash. Come earlier and enjoy the Sunday Lunch!

There can be only one winner video

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=owMsDhWo-PY

The Game of Hurling for men of courage.

The oldest field game in Europe, the fastest field game in the world - just two of the things we are able to boast about this ancient celtic game.A traditional Irish field sport in which a ball, called a sliotar, is caught on a hurley, or stick, and carried, or hurled into the opponent's goal. Irish mythology has tales of the warrior Cu Chulainn and other legendary heroes who were expert hurlers. The rules of play were standardized in 1884 when the Gaelic Athletic Association was founded. Today the game is almost entirely restricted to Ireland, where the All-Ireland championship competition has been held since 1887.

How the game is played...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurling

Cork is now becoming known as the “New Orleans of Europe” and on its way to being the multicultural and multilingual Capital of the South with an established reputation for its friendliness and a musical city of 1000 welcomes.

Cork with many bridges over its famous river Lee  over- looked by its iconic Shandon Bells is also a City the serves as an Irish bridge to bridge Europe and the United States.

 

Cork jazz festival boasts 1,000 acts

The line-up for the 2012 Guinness Cork Jazz Festival, which takes place from October 26-28, features more than 1,000 musicians from 22 countries. This year's festival welcomes an eclectic mix of performers, including De La Soul, Beach House, Jean Toussaint and Natalie Williams.

Guinness Cork Jazz Festival takes place in late October each year in Ireland's scenic southern capital of Cork. It is one of Ireland's flagship arts and cultural events, attracting visitors from all over the world. The festival continues to go from strength to strength with a superb programme of world class jazz and jazz related sounds in over 90 venues. It is renowned as one of the best jazz festivals in Europe. Over the years the many of the top names in jazz have featured including Ella Fitzgerald, Dizzy Gillespie, Chick Corea, Herbie Hancock and dozens more. There's a superb music trail offering music free of entrance charges and a buzzing Festival Club - plus street entertainment, workshops, lectures, a jazz choir, a Jazz Camp for student musicians, and lots of participation events. Cork becomes Europe's jazz capital at the exciting Guinness Cork Jazz Festival weekend!

description:
Event Reminder
The Magic of Irish Music - Druid – One day stop in Belgium on European Tour
At the

De Werf, Aalst

Saturday 27 October,2013

DRUID vibrantly captures the essence of the modern Irish spirit.
Through the years, Ireland’s people have spread their wings far beyond their island shores, influencing, enrapturing, and changing countless individuals and societies across the globe.
DRUID is a salute to their Irishness and to all who have kept this core and substance alive – wherever they may dwell.
DRUID summons its audience along a musical journey, emerging from the haze of Ireland’s pre-Christian times, traveling the paths of oppression, famine, emigration, on to the “Celtic Tiger” economy, and finally resting on the hopes of the future. It is a celebration of passion for life:an epic tale of mankind’s determination and ability to shine ever brighter in the face of strife and misfortune.
The performers in DRUID each possess an exceptional talent, ranging in scope from Irish traditional to ballad to pop to classical. Brought together, they form a cohesive musical and vocal unit that is mesmerizing and uplifting, a unique concert experience that is as much Irish as it is Global.

Tickets at
http://www.ccdewerf.be/agenda/20/druid#.UIpNNWecTvw

http://www.druid-music.com/?DRUID

De Werf Molenstraat 51, 9300 Aalst
name: Event Concert Reminder -The Magic of Irish Music   Druid

description:
2nd. Annual Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday.

The Irish in Europe Association (International) AISBL in compliance with its aims and objectives remembers all Irish and the Irish Diaspora in all armies who died in all wars and conflicts. IEAI in particular remembers the 50,000 Irish who died and estimated 500,000 members of the Irish Diaspora in all Armies who participated during the liberation of Belgium in the first and second world wars.

Let those who come after us see to it that their names be not forgotten
Hence it will have its second Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday in Brussels on Saturday 10 November at 11 am. The IEAI will lay a wreath at the Anglo-Belgian War Memorial at Place Poelaert / Poelaertplein in front of Palais de Justice de Bruxelles and across from the Infantry Memorial of Brussels in memory of the Belgian foot soldiers who fought in World War I and II. (Metro or Tram Louise 3 minutes walk). The Anglo-Belgian War Memorial commemorates the heroic Belgian people who helped the Irish and British prisoners of war during World War I. Designed by the British sculptor Charles Sargeant Jagger [masked]), the monument was inaugurated in 1923. The composition, in Brainvilliers stone, features figures of Irish, British and Belgian soldiers. The sides are covered with reliefs representing scenes of Belgian common folk tending to wounded British soldiers. There is also a relief of an Irish harp. A plaster cast of the statues of soldiers can be seen at the Military Museum in Brussels. Following the laying of the wreath, a poem by Irish Poet Francis Ledwidge will be recited. He enlisted in the Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers in 1914 and was killed in the battle of Ypres on the 31st July 1917. See www.francisledwidge.com . After the ceremony, guests shall proceed to Mac Sweeney's Irish Pub for warm refreshments at Jean Stasstraat, Brussels 1060 located to the right of Avenue Louise about 7 minutes walk from the memorial. On the way the group shall stop at the site of the former residence in exile of William Smith O Brien, one of the leaders of the Irish Rebellion of 1848 and direct descendent of King Brian Boru who was killed at the Battle of Clontarf in 1014. He also lived in Hungary where he advised the Hungarian Independence Movement. Every one is welcome to come along to the second annual Irish in Europe Remembrance Saturday ceremony.
“Your Donation to help defray costs would be much appreciated“

Bank: Centea
Name account: IEAI
Account nr:[masked]
IBAN: BE[masked]
SWIFT/BIC-code: BIC SPAABE22

[masked]

Irish Peace Tower in Flanders http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Island_of_Ireland_Peace_Park

http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/f/2/event_79322802.jpegCLADDAGH ENGLISH/IRISH TOASTMASTERS CLUB OF BRUSSELS TOASTMASTER AN CHLADAIGH – CLUB DÁTHEANGACH NA BRUISÉILE

Claddagh Toastmasters helps you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, leadership training, and managing your time. We aim is to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice  your skills.

Next meeting: 15th of November will be a special meeting with a great presentation  in English  by Phil Yaffe: “Would the United States of America Be a Valid Model for a United States of Europe ? “ . There will be a Q&A session afterwards. For those of you who do not know Phil, refer to the attachment: it is an article published by Phil on how to avoid the boring Power Point presentation. Take it as a free appetizer: https://sites.google.com/site/claddaghtoastmasters/library/articles/article_of_month_july_2012

Last thing (finally !!!): the first part of the next meeting will be held as usual with lots of Table Topics and impromptu speeches.

Please let us know you are coming by reserving your place to [masked]


We are a bilingual Irish-English club with a membership from about ten different nationalities, which requires that most members have a good oral command of Irish and or English. However, in practice, this is not really possible unless we have a high number of Irish speakers at all meetings , so we are very pleased to welcome English-only speakers. To date, the use of Irish and English is fairly balanced for some sessions during an evening . For example, the Toastmaster of the evening performs performing his/her role in both Irish and English, and we try to alternate speeches and table topics being between both languages, whenever possible but for the coming months we may have English only sessions until the membership of our Irish speakers increases.

Guests are welcome, and will be asked for a short introduction at the start of the meeting and for their feedback at the end of the meeting. Come and experience it for yourself!

The ultimate objective of the meeting is to emphasise how planning can play an important role in active aging and how Toastmasters is an ideal organisation to serve all generations to help you plan and enjoy an active life.

email  [masked], to confirm your place. Admission is free. We meet at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Métro Schuman), on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm. Meeting starts at 7pm sharp.

www.toastmasters.org

https://sites.google.com/site/claddaghtoastmasters/

description:
In front of the Irish Embassy, Chaussee d'Etterbeek 180, Bruxelles 1040, Belgium

Metro Schuman or Maelbeek-Embassy across the road from Parc Leopold.

The local Police have given permission for a one hour protest. Start to assemble from 17.40 with some candle-holders with tea lights. Organisers will bring some along but bring your own if you can. Official Start at 18.00.

This is a protest vigil organised by concerned Irish Citizens together with members of the Irish Diaspora and members of the International Community in Europe over the tragic death of Savita Halappanavar.Savita Halappanavar, 31, was 17 weeks pregnant when she died at Galway University Hospital on October 28 after suffering a miscarriage and septicaemia. Her husband Praveen alleged his wife, who is a dentist, pleaded with doctors to perform a medical termination. Doctors are said to have denied her requests because the foetus's heartbeat was present - reportedly telling her: "This is a Catholic country." She was not able to get a medical termination because the Irish State failed to respect a decision of the Irish Supreme Court in 1992 to put in place guide lines that could have saved her life.See Editorial from Irish Examiner on her death.

http://www.irishexaminer.com/opinion/editorial/savita-halappanavar--failure-to-lead-has-cost-us-dearly-214117.html#.UKaJSezCt04.twitter

The Irish Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church issued a statement and said ”Where a seriously ill pregnant woman needs medical treatment which may put the life of her baby at risk, such treatments are ethically permissible provided every effort has been made to save the life of both the mother and her baby” see full statement.http://www.irishexaminer.com/breakingnews/ireland/bishops-express-sympathy-for-halapanavar-but-support-current-legal-and-medical-measures-574820.html#.UKq9o6VtktA.twitter

The Irish Times has created a day by day analysis of the response from around the world to the tragic loss of her life. http://www.irishtimes.com/topics/death-of-savita/

The husband of Savita Halaqpannavar, Mr Praveen Halappanavar through his solicitor has already written to the Irish  Minister for Health James Reilly seeking a full public sworn inquiry into the death. His Solicitor Mr. Gerard O’Donnell said an independent inquiry. This would see oral hearings held in public, a full discovery of records and witnesses called in under oath and cross examined in public. : "Any inquiry conducted by the HSE (Health Service Executive) does not meet with his approval. He has no faith in the HSE.“It's important to remember that he lost his wife while under the care of the HSE", he added.

Every one is welcome to attend the vigil. FR and NL après l'anglais, .

UPDATE: If you would like to share your experiences or speak at the vigil, please email us in advance: [masked]

After the tragic death of Savita Halappanavar, there have been protests across Ireland. We are gathering outside the Irish embassy to show that - as Irish citizens abroad and Europeans alike - we stand with women in Ireland.

Savita Halappanavar died in an Irish hospital suffering and in pain after being denied an abortion she and her husband repeatedly requested.

Enough is enough. No more women can die.

Feel free to bring candles, signs or anything else you feel appropriate. We ask that any parties/organisations limit their organsiation logo banner to one per organisation.

Any other suggestions for the event, please email [masked]

Please spread this amongst your friends, and any groups you feel are relevant.

NB: The Irish embassy is in a different location to the Perm Rep. Not the same building.

More information on the tragedy: http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/frontpage/2012/1114/1224326575203.html

FRANCAIS
Plus jamais ça! Veillée à Bruxelles à la mémoire de Savita et pour protester contre la loi irlandaise sur l'avortement.

Ambassade d'Irlande, Chaussee d'Etterbeek 180, Bruxelles 1040, Belgium

Mise à Jour: Si vous souhaitez partager vos expériences ou parler lors de la veillée, merci de nous envoyer un mail dès maintenant à: [masked]

Après la mort tragique de Savita Halappanavar, de nombreuses protestations ont eu lieu partout en Irlande. Nous nous réunissons devant l'Ambassade d'Irlande afin de montrer que nous, en tant que citoyens irlandais vivant à l'étranger mais aussi citoyens européens, nous sommes aux côtés des femmes d'Irlande.

Savita Halappanavar, qui a énormément souffert jusqu'au dernier moment, est décédée dans un hôpital irlandais après qu'on lui ait refusé un avortement que son mari et elle même ont pourtant réclamé à maintes reprises.

Trop c'est trop. Plus aucune femme ne doit mourir.

N'hésitez pas à ramener des bougies, pancartes ou n'importe quoi d'autre qui vous semblera approprié. Nous demandons aux partis/organisations de se limiter à une bannière/banderole par organisation.

Si vous avez d'autres suggestions pour l'évènement, envoyer un email à [masked]

N'hésitez pas à partager cet "évènement" auprès de vos ami-e-s ou de tout autre groupe en rapport.

NB: l'Ambassade irlandaise est située à un endroit différent de la Représentation Permanente, ce n'est pas le même bâtiment.

Pour plus d'informations sur la tragédie (seulement en Anglais): http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/frontpage/2012/1114/1224326575203.html

(Merci à Léa Bareil pour la traduction française.)

NEDERLANDS
Dit nooit meer! Brusselse wake voor Savita en protestbijeenkomst tegen de Ierse abortuswetgeving.

Ierse Ambassade, Etterbeeksesteenweg 180, 1040 Brussel

Update : indien u ervaringen wil delen of wenst te spreken op de wake, laat ons iets weten per e-mail : [masked]

Na de tragische dood van Savita Halappanavar, vonden er protestacties plaats over heel Ierland. We komen op onze beurt samen aan de Ierse ambassade om te tonen dat we – zowel als Ierse onderdanen in het buitenland, als Europeanen – aan de zijde van vrouwen in Ierland staan.

Savita Halappanavar stierf een zeer pijnlijke dood in een Iers ziekenhuis omdat werd geweigerd een abortus uit te voeren waar zij en haar echtgenoot herhaaldelijk op hadden aangedrongen.

Dit kan zo niet verder! Er mogen geen vrouwen meer sterven!

Aarzel niet om kaarsen, borden of andere zaken mee te brengen die u passend vindt. We vragen dat partijen/organisaties eventuele borden of spandoeken met logo’s beperken tot één per organisatie.

Voor verdere voorstellen in verband met de actie, gelieve te e-mailen naar [masked]

Verspreid deze oproep onder uw vrienden en andere groepen die u relevant acht.

NB: de Ierse ambassade bevindt zich op een andere plaats dan de Permanente Vertegenwoordiging. Het is niet hetzelfde gebouw.

Voor meer informatie over de tragedie : http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/frontpage/2012/1114/1224326575203.html

Map/Facebook page/more information: http://bit.ly/SavitaBrussels
name: Invitation to: Never Again - Brussels Candlelight Vigil for Savita Halappanavar

Attendees can meet up first for a pre-show drink at 7pm.All attendees buy your own tickets directly from the Ticket Office.

http://www.forestnational.be/fr/calendrier/tous-les-genres/p/detail/lord-of-the-dance-4

Lord Of The Dance de Michael Flatley est l’un des spectacles de danse les plus époustouflants au monde. Michael Flatley a donné une nouvelle dimension aux shows, comme en témoignent les 75 millions spectateurs - et même plus – à ce jour.
Depuis sa première, au Point Theater à Dublin, en 1996, « Lord of the Dance » a conquis la planète. C’est le premier spectacle de ce type à avoir rempli 21 fois la Wembley Arena à Londres. Aujourd’hui, pas moins de quatre troupes se produisent simultanément au Japon, en Afrique du Sud, en Europe et aux Etats-Unis
Danseur, artiste et musicien, Michael Flatley, champion mondial de danse celtique, est le créateur de Lord Of The Dance mais aussi du célèbre spectacle Riverdance. Pour des millions de fans aux quatre coins de la planète, Michael Flatley fait figure de génie dans le monde de la danse. Il a réussi l’exploit de hisser à un niveau international la magie de la danse folklorique celtique
La chorégraphie extrêmement précise, les décors, la scène à couper le souffle et la complexité visuelle des danses en feront un spectacle tout à fait éblouissant.
Laissez-vous ensorceler par la magie du Michael Flatley's 'Lord of the Dance' le 4 décembre 2012 à Forest National.
name: Invitation  to Lord of the Dance at Forest National-Brussels

description:
CLADDAGH ENGLISH/IRISH TOASTMASTERS CLUB OF BRUSSELS TOASTMASTER AN CHLADAIGH – CLUB DÁTHEANGACH NA BRUISÉILE

Claddagh Toastmasters helps you to develop your skills in public speaking, planning, leadership training, and managing your time. We aim is to provide a fun and social environment in which to practice your skills.
Take it as a free appetizer: https://sites.google.com/site/claddaghtoastmasters/library/articles/article_of_month_july_2012

Please let us know you are coming by reserving your place to [masked]. Admission Free!.

We are a bilingual Irish-English club with a membership from about ten different nationalities, which requires that most members have a good oral command of Irish and or English. However, in practice, this is not really possible unless we have a high number of Irish speakers at all meetings , so we are very pleased to welcome English-only speakers. To date, the use of Irish and English is fairly balanced for some sessions during an evening . For example, the Toastmaster of the evening performs performing his/her role in both Irish and English, and we try to alternate speeches and table topics being between both languages, whenever possible but for the coming months we may have English only sessions until the membership of our Irish speakers increases.

Guests are welcome, and will be asked for a short introduction at the start of the meeting and for their feedback at the end of the meeting. Come and experience it for yourself!

The ultimate objective of the meeting is to emphasise how communication and planning can play an important role in the home and work place and how Toastmasters is an ideal organisation to serve all generations to help you plan and enjoy an active life.

Last thing (finally !!!): the first part of the meeting will be held as usual with lots of Table Topics and impromptu speeches and second part consists of prepared speeches given by members in accordence with set objectives followed by evaluations to imrove .There is no obligation for guests to speak unless they agree to do so.

email [masked], to confirm your place. Admission is free. We meet at the Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels (Métro Schuman), on the first and third Thursday of the month. Welcome coffee at 6.45 pm. Meeting starts at 7pm sharp.

We then go a local pub afterwards for a social drink......

Every one is welcome to attend and admission is free. Even though you may not be in Brussels, we would kindly ask you to forward this invitation to any friends you have that will be in Brussels.

description:
Lunch time session

A high-quality introduction to Brussels

Brussels can be a complex city, especially for newcomers. Therefore the Brussels-Europe Liaison (BELO) organises on a regular basis a class called 'Discover Brussels'. It provides you with all the background information you need to help you understand this city and to find your way around more easily. Learn about its history, its social-economic and demographic situation, the institutional structure and gain an insight into the challenges the city is facing. The class will be given by Eric Corijn, professor from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB).

The next lunch time session “Discover Brussels” will take place on Wednesday 16 January from 12.30 pm to 2 pm in the main office of the Brussels-Europe Liaison Office, av. d’Auderghem 63, 1040 Brussels.Sandwiches and drinks will be provided. Participation is free, but registration is required. You can enroll by sending an email direct to [masked].
name: 'Discover Brussels'- Lunch time session-Introduction to Brussels
